adm:managed-object.name: repeated-characters-password-validator
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
is used to determine whether a proposed password is acceptable based on the number of times any character may appear consecutively in a password value.

adm:property.name: maximum-consecutive-length
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the maximum number of times that any character may appear consecutively in a password value.
adm:property.adm:description: Specifies the maximum number of times that any character may appear consecutively in a password value. A value of zero indicates that there will be no maximum limit enforced. Changes to this configuration attribute will take effect immediately.

adm:property.name: case-sensitive-validation
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator should treat password characters in a case-sensitive manner.
adm:property.adm:description: Indicates whether this password validator should treat password characters in a case-sensitive manner. A value of false indicates that any differences in capitalization should be ignored when looking for consecutive characters in the password. A value of true indicates that a character should only be considered repeating if all consecutive occurrences use the same capitalization.
